question: Match the following:
column_II: Semen is released by the penis into the vagina (insemination)
Cervix → uterus → ampullary region of fallopian tube
Ovum and sperms must be transported simultaneously to the ampullary region
Blocks entry of additional sperms ensuring only one sperm fertilises the ovum

matches.right: Semen is released by the penis into the vagina (insemination)
Cervix → uterus → ampullary region of fallopian tube
Ovum and sperms must be transported simultaneously to the ampullary region
Blocks entry of additional sperms ensuring only one sperm fertilises the ovum

answer: During copulation (coitus) → Semen is released by the penis into the vagina (insemination), Sperms swim through → Cervix → uterus → ampullary region of fallopian tube, Fertilisation location → Ampullary region of fallopian tube, Requirement for fertilisation → Ovum and sperms must be transported simultaneously to the ampullary region, Function of zona pellucida changes → Blocks entry of additional sperms ensuring only one sperm fertilises the ovum

question: Match the following:
column_I: Process of fusion of sperm with ovum
Why not all copulations lead to pregnancy
column_II: Help sperm enter cytoplasm of ovum
Break zona pellucida and plasma membrane
Ovum and sperms may not reach ampullary region simultaneously
Ovum is transported to ampullary region

matches.right: Help sperm enter cytoplasm of ovum
Break zona pellucida and plasma membrane

matches.left: Why not all copulations lead to pregnancy
matches.right: Ovum and sperms may not reach ampullary region simultaneously

answer: Process of fusion of sperm with ovum → Fertilisation, Acrosome secretions → Help sperm enter cytoplasm of ovum, Purpose of acrosome enzymes → Break zona pellucida and plasma membrane, Why not all copulations lead to pregnancy → Ovum and sperms may not reach ampullary region simultaneously, Ovum transport → Ovum is transported to ampullary region
